qas.question: What was the business state of Marvel by 2000?
When did Marvel withdraw from the Comics Code Authority?
What in-house standards system did Marvel replace the Comics Code with?
What was the first book published under this new ratings system?
What was the name of the adult themed comics imprint for Marvel with more explicit content?
When did Marvel Comics file for bankruptcy?
When did Marvel join the Comics Code Authority?
When was the first issue of MAX released?
What did Marvel Comics replace the Marvel Rating System with?
What age bracket was Marvel Adventures designed for?

context: With <b5_0>the new millennium<b5_0/>, Marvel Comics emerged from <a0_0>bankruptcy<a0_0/> and again began diversifying its offerings. In <a1_0><b6_0>2001<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Marvel withdrew from the <b8_0>Comics Code Authority<b8_0/> and established its own <a2_0>Marvel Rating System<a2_0/> for comics. The first title from this era to not have the code was <a3_0>X-Force #119<a3_0/> (<b7_0>October 2001<b7_0/>). Marvel also created new imprints, such as <a4_0>MAX<a4_0/> (an explicit-content line) and Marvel Adventures (developed for <b9_0>child audiences<b9_0/>). In addition, the company created an alternate universe imprint, Ultimate Marvel, that allowed the company to reboot its major titles by revising and updating its characters to introduce to a new generation.
